title: Design plugin system for custom modules
description: Deliver the pluggable module system described in the plan: support Go-built modules, yaegi-evaluated Go files, YAML-defined skill modules, discovery from .lattice/modules/, and documentation for extension authors.

title: Design plugin module schema
description: Define the ModuleDefinition struct/fields for plugin modules (ID, description, skill, inputs/outputs, config).

title: Implement YAML-based module loader
description: Load module definitions from workflows/*.yaml or modules/*.yaml into Module factories.

title: Load Go plugin modules via yaegi
description: Support .lattice/modules/*.go modules interpreted via yaegi (or similar) per the plan.

title: Implement skill-based plugin runner
description: Add support for YAML modules that bind to skills so non-Go authors can define modules.

title: Implement plugin discovery wiring
description: Scan .lattice/modules/ for Go/YAML modules and register them alongside built-ins.

title: Document plugin API and sample
description: Write documentation + an example plugin module to demonstrate how to extend the system.

title: Convert remaining modes into modules
description: Extract orchestration/hiring/release flow into modules: orchestrator-selection, hiring, work-process, refinement, release. Each must declare inputs/outputs, reuse shared helpers, and register with the engine.

title: Capture orchestrator-selection inputs and outputs
description: List required artifacts (consolidation markers, plan docs) and expected orchestrator JSON output.

title: Port release logic into a module
description: Implement ReleaseModule and ensure it can run after work-process/refinement.

title: Register remaining modules and wire workflows
description: Add registry entries and ensure built-in workflow definitions reference the new modules.

title: Port orchestrator-selection logic into a module
description: Implement OrchestratorSelectionModule with proper checks and registration.

title: Capture hiring inputs and outputs
description: Document dependencies on orchestrator JSON, modules doc, plan doc, beads-created marker, etc.

title: Port hiring logic into a module
description: Implement HiringModule with input validation and worker artifact creation (workers.json + AGENT.md files).

title: Capture work-process inputs and outputs
description: Document prerequisites coming out of hiring and the work process artifacts/logs produced.

title: Port work-process logic into a module
description: Implement WorkProcessModule with run flow and provenance metadata.

title: Capture refinement inputs and outputs
description: Note that refinement is optional and depends on work-process outputs.

title: Port refinement logic into a module
description: Implement optional RefinementModule with IsComplete checks.

title: Capture release inputs and outputs
description: Enumerate artifacts needed for release and the release outputs.

title: Extract anchor-docs module
description: Carve the existing phaseAnchorDocs logic into a standalone anchor-docs module that declares no file inputs, outputs COMMISSION.md/ARCHITECTURE.md/CONVENTIONS.md, writes provenance frontmatter, and can run independently via the skill session window.
close_reason: Anchor-docs module extracted, registered, frontmatter + CLI runner shipped

title: List anchor-docs inputs and outputs
description: Document the artifact refs (commission, architecture, conventions) and confirm the module has no required inputs per the table.
close_reason: Initial anchor-docs module landed with CLI + checklist

title: Create AnchorDocsModule struct and register it
description: Move the phaseAnchorDocs state into an AnchorDocsModule that implements Module and is registered in the ModuleRegistry.
close_reason: Initial anchor-docs module landed with CLI + checklist

title: Wire Run to skill/tmux session
description: Ensure the module launches the planning skill window exactly like the current phase does, returning the poll tick message.
close_reason: Initial anchor-docs module landed with CLI + checklist

title: Implement IsComplete checks
description: Use ArtifactStore.Check for each output to determine when the module is done.
close_reason: Initial anchor-docs module landed with CLI + checklist

title: Write frontmatter for anchor artifacts
description: Inject lattice metadata into COMMISSION.md/ARCHITECTURE.md/CONVENTIONS.md when they are written or updated.
close_reason: Initial anchor-docs module landed with CLI + checklist

title: Create standalone test checklist
description: Provide a short checklist or script to execute anchor-docs independently to verify frontmatter + outputs.
close_reason: Initial anchor-docs module landed with CLI + checklist

title: Extract remaining planning modules
description: Convert the rest of planning mode substeps into modules (action-plan, staff-review, staff-incorporate, parallel-reviews, consolidation, bead-creation). Each module must declare explicit inputs/outputs, reuse the skill invocation where needed, write frontmatter, and be runnable independently.
close_reason: All planning modules, docs, and tests implemented.

title: Capture action-plan inputs and outputs
description: List the artifact refs needed (anchor docs) and produced (MODULES.md, PLAN.md) for the action-plan module.
close_reason: Documented action-plan module IO contract

title: Port consolidation logic into a module
description: Implement ConsolidationModule that applies reviews and writes the marker with metadata.
close_reason: Implemented ConsolidationModule with marker handling.

title: Capture bead-creation inputs and outputs
description: Enumerate required artifacts and the .beads-created marker output.
close_reason: Documented bead-creation inputs/outputs.

title: Port bead-creation logic into a module
description: Implement BeadCreationModule that writes the marker and any necessary bead files.
close_reason: Implemented BeadCreationModule with bd init and marker handling.

title: Ensure planning modules emit frontmatter
description: Verify each module writes lattice metadata to every artifact it touches.
close_reason: Added runtime helpers that enforce frontmatter across planning modules.

title: Add module-level tests for planning suite
description: Write lightweight tests or scripts to run each planning module individually to confirm contracts and metadata.
close_reason: Added module-level tests verifying planning outputs and markers.

title: Port action-plan logic into a module
description: Move phaseActionPlan behavior into ActionPlanModule with Run/IsComplete and registry entry.
close_reason: Implemented ActionPlanModule with tmux orchestration and registry entry.

title: Capture staff-review inputs and outputs
description: Document that staff-review consumes action-plan docs and emits STAFF_REVIEW.md.
close_reason: Documented staff review inputs and outputs.

title: Port staff-review logic into a module
description: Implement StaffReviewModule with skill invocation, metadata writing, and registration.
close_reason: Implemented StaffReviewModule with tmux orchestration and metadata.

title: Capture staff-incorporate inputs and outputs
description: Note that it consumes staff review + plan docs and writes updated MODULES.md/PLAN.md.
close_reason: Documented staff-incorporate inputs/outputs.

title: Port staff-incorporate logic into a module
description: Implement StaffIncorporateModule with correct artifacts and provenance.
close_reason: Implemented StaffIncorporateModule and registry entry.

title: Capture parallel-reviews inputs and outputs
description: Define dependencies on updated plan docs and enumerate the four reviewer output files.
close_reason: Documented parallel reviews inputs/outputs.

title: Port parallel-reviews logic with reviewer config
description: Implement ParallelReviewsModule that spawns reviewers per config overrides (pragmatist, simplifier, advocate, skeptic).
close_reason: Implemented ParallelReviewsModule with reviewer prompts and metadata.

title: Capture consolidation inputs and outputs
description: Document dependence on review files and the .reviews-applied marker output.
close_reason: Documented consolidation inputs/outputs.

title: Ship alternative workflows and selection UI
description: Define the quick-start and solo workflows, including their graphs and configs, and add a workflow picker to the main menu so users can choose which workflow to run.

title: Define quick-start workflow graph
description: Encode the quick-start module list (anchor-docs, action-plan, bead-creation, orchestrator-selection, hiring, work-process) with dependencies.

title: Define solo workflow graph
description: Encode the solo workflow (anchor-docs, action-plan, solo-work module) per the plan and ensure solo module placeholder exists.

title: Add workflow selection UI
description: Update the main menu/TUI entrypoint to let users choose between commission-work, quick-start, and solo workflows.

title: Test workflow definitions
description: Add tests that load the workflows and verify dependency graphs are valid.

title: Document workflow choices
description: Update docs to describe each workflow, when to use it, and required modules.

title: Establish modular runtime foundation
description: Implement the modular runtime core from MODULAR_WORKFLOW_PLAN: add the Module interface (identity, contracts, execution, TUI methods), define ArtifactRef/ArtifactType plus ArtifactStore and ModuleContext, build the ModuleRegistry + base helper, add YAML/JSON frontmatter metadata for provenance, restructure directories to the proposed layout, and document module versioning + artifact invalidation rules that keep downstream artifacts honest. This epic is the prerequisite for the rest of the migration.
close_reason: Foundation scaffolding landed; workflows can now build on modules

title: Outline Mode vs Module responsibilities
description: Read the current Mode interface and the "Module Definition" section to summarize required responsibilities (identity, inputs/outputs, execution hooks) so the new Module interface mirrors the plan.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Document versioning and invalidation policy
description: Capture decisions for module versioning upgrades and downstream artifact invalidation (open questions #1 and #5) in docs/design notes.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Implement Module interface skeleton
description: Create internal/module/module.go with the interface methods (ID/Name/Description/Inputs/Outputs/IsComplete/Run/Update/View) exactly as specified in the plan snippet.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Define ArtifactRef and ArtifactType
description: Add the ArtifactRef struct plus ArtifactType enum (File, Directory, Marker, JSON) so modules can declare contracts.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Draft ArtifactStore with Check/Write helpers
description: Scaffold internal/artifact/store.go so modules can check for artifacts, parse frontmatter, and read/write file metadata.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Add ModuleRegistry with Register/Get
description: Implement the registry map + factory pattern so modules can be registered and instantiated via config overrides.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Introduce ModuleContext struct
description: Create a ModuleContext wrapper that exposes artifact store, config, logger, and workflow metadata to each module, matching the plan.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Add module base helper
description: Add internal/module/base.go with shared helpers (polling, skill launch) so modules can reuse boilerplate per the proposed file tree.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Create modular directory skeleton
description: Lay down the directories/files proposed in "File Structure After Refactor" (internal/module, artifact, modules/*, workflow, etc.).
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Implement frontmatter parser/writer
description: Add internal/artifact/frontmatter.go functions to parse/write YAML frontmatter for markdown and _lattice metadata for JSON artifacts.
close_reason: Initial modular runtime scaffolding landed in repo

title: Build workflow engine and dependency resolver
description: Implement the workflow definition/resolver/engine stack so workflows compose modules into execution graphs, automatically resolve missing dependencies, handle artifact validation, support config overrides, and connect to the Bubbletea TUI with future parallel execution.

title: Define WorkflowDefinition structs
description: Create internal/workflow/definition.go with WorkflowDefinition and ModuleRef structs per the plan snippet.
close_reason: Workflow type definitions and validation helpers landed

title: Document error recovery path
description: Describe and implement how failed modules resume from checkpoint (open question #4).

title: Add resolver/engine unit tests
description: Cover dependency resolution, artifact validation, and resume cases with tests.

title: Implement workflow graph loader
description: Add helpers (and YAML loader) to instantiate WorkflowDefinition structs from Go/YAML definitions.
close_reason: YAML loader + normalization helpers implemented

title: Build dependency resolver core
description: Implement Resolver that builds the graph, filters runnable modules, and queues prerequisites when inputs missing.

title: Implement artifact check/invalidation hook
description: Finish Resolver.CheckArtifact to validate frontmatter, detect missing/invalid/outdated artifacts, and surface status codes.

title: Implement runnable module selection
description: Add logic to skip completed modules and return runnable sets for execution.

title: Build workflow engine start/resume/update
description: Implement Engine struct with Start/Resume/Update/View wrappers.

title: Integrate engine with TUI app
description: Update the Bubbletea app to delegate workflow execution to the engine instead of hard-coded phases.

title: Design parallel execution strategy
description: Decide and document how independent modules will run in parallel (open question #2) and add the necessary hooks.

title: Document config override strategy
description: Record how ModuleRef.Config maps to module-specific overrides (open question #3).
